security_audit.summary: All 18 static findings are false positives. Scanner misinterpreted markdown code formatting (backticks) as command execution, GitHub URLs as network endpoints, and metacognitive terms as security threats. This is a benign metacognitive guidance skill with no actual security risks.

content.user_title: Escalate Complex Problems to Deep-Thinking Agents
content.value_statement: Claude sometimes struggles with highly complex problems that require deep analysis. This skill monitors your responses for struggle signals and recommends proactive escalation to deep-thinking agents before quality degrades.
actual_capabilities: Monitor responses for struggle signals like hedging, deflection, and contradictions
Provide a self-assessment checklist before responding to complex questions
Suggest proactive escalation to deep-thinking agents based on complexity indicators
Guide users on crafting effective escalation prompts with context and constraints
Help identify high-complexity situations requiring multi-domain synthesis
Track and improve personal struggle detection awareness over time
limitations: Cannot automatically trigger agent escalation without user permission
Does not access external tools or files for analysis
Struggle detection is based on pattern recognition, not perfect understanding
Cannot replace human judgment on when escalation is truly necessary

use_cases.title: Architectural Decision Support
use_cases.description: When facing complex system design decisions with competing constraints across performance, maintainability, and cost dimensions, escalate to deep-thinking agents for structured analysis.

use_cases.title: Multi-Domain Problem Solving
use_cases.description: When problems span multiple technology areas without obvious integration patterns, use the skill to recognize the need for specialized deep analysis.

use_cases.title: Quality Response Calibration
use_cases.description: New Claude users learning to recognize when their responses lack confidence or clarity can use this skill to improve response quality through self-assessment.
use_cases.target_user: Users new to Claude and AI assistants

prompt_templates.title: Basic Struggle Check
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm about to respond to a user question. Help me check if I should escalate: Can I give a concrete recommendation with high confidence? Is this answerable without multiple follow-ups? Would structured analysis help?

prompt_templates.title: Complexity Evaluation
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this problem for escalation indicators: Does it involve architectural decisions with competing constraints? Are requirements ambiguous? Does it require multi-domain synthesis? Does it need edge case analysis?

prompt_templates.title: Crafting Escalation Prompt
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create an effective escalation prompt for the deep-think-partner agent. Include: system context, specific constraints, success criteria, and the core question needing analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Post-Escalation Synthesis
prompt_templates.prompt: The deep-think-partner returned analysis on [topic]. Help me synthesize the key insight, present a clear recommendation, and offer an implementation plan for the user.

output_examples.input: Should we use Redis or PostgreSQL for session storage?
output: Self-assessment triggered: Multiple valid approaches exist, depends on constraints not yet explored.
Escalation recommended: This is an architectural decision with competing constraints.
Escalation prompt crafted for deep-think-partner with context about 10k concurrent users, existing PostgreSQL database, and team expertise constraints.

output_examples.input: I'm about to explain a complex microservices pattern
output: Checking for struggle signals: Are you confident in your recommendation?
Self-assessment checklist: Can you give a concrete recommendation?
Consider proactive escalation if multiple valid approaches exist or trade-offs span different dimensions.

best_practices: Use the self-assessment checklist before responding to any complex question - answer honestly about your confidence level.
Escalate proactively when you detect ambiguity in requirements or multiple valid architectural approaches.
After receiving deep-thinking analysis, synthesize the key insight rather than pasting the full response.
anti_patterns: Responding with 'it depends' without identifying the specific constraints that matter.
Continuing to struggle through a complex problem without considering escalation.
Pasting deep-thinking partner output verbatim without synthesizing for the user.

faq.question: Does this skill automatically escalate to other agents?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance and recommendations but requires you to trigger escalation through the Task tool. You maintain full control over when to engage deep-thinking agents.

faq.question: How does struggle detection work?
faq.answer: The skill identifies patterns like hedging language, deflection, contradictions, verbose responses without concrete output, and non-committal recommendations. Use the self-assessment checklist to catch these early.

faq.question: What makes a problem complex enough to escalate?
faq.answer: Indicators include architectural decisions with competing constraints, ambiguous requirements, multi-domain synthesis needs, and edge case analysis requirements. The skill provides specific checklists for each category.

faq.question: Can I use this with other thinking or reasoning skills?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill complements other reasoning tools by helping you recognize when deeper analysis would improve response quality. It does not replace structured thinking approaches.

faq.question: How accurate is the struggle detector?
faq.answer: The detector relies on pattern recognition in your own responses. It may produce false positives or miss genuine struggles. Track your triggers over time to calibrate your personal patterns.

faq.question: What should I include in an escalation prompt?
faq.answer: Include context about the system or codebase, specific constraints limiting the solution, clear success criteria, and the specific question or decision needing analysis. The skill provides templates for each element.
